description: Pole vaulter Mondo Duplantis soared roughly a foot higher than the silver and bronze medalists. And he kept setting the  bar higher, breaking the world record.
title: Pole vaulter Mondo Duplantis is breaking records at the Olympics

description: To take a measure of where the election stands, we have a new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll out Tuesday that shows Vice President Harris gaining a slight lead nationally on former President Donald Trump.
title: Harris takes a slight national lead over Trump in new poll

description: Space X’s highly anticipated Polaris Dawn mission is set to launch later this summer – with an all-civilian crew. And a big part of their mission is researching how space changes the human body.
title: How does space change the human body? The answer will shapes future missions

description: Cindy Nava could become one of the first former DACA recipients to win during a general election in the U.S. She already won the primary race earlier this year for a state senate seat in New Mexico.
title: A former DACA recipient, Cindy Nava is running for public office in New Mexico

description: While Florida is cleaning up from Hurricane Debby, the storm is still dumping record amounts of rain onto Coastal Georgia and South Carolina.
title: Debby is expected to continue drenching eastern South Carolina

description: A boxing federation claims Khelif failed two unspecified gender tests, but Olympic officials say those tests were illegitimate. The gold medal match will be held Friday.
title: Imane Khelif, the Algerian snared in political controversy, will box for Olympic gold

description: In several British cities over the past week, racist mobs have attacked mosques, hotels housing immigrants — or anyone of color. The riots that have been enflamed by misinformation online.
title: The U.K.’s far right has stirred violent, racist attacks in British cities

description: This week the prime minister of Bangladesh fled the country by helicopter, forced out by a protest movement that started peacefully but became violent. We hear from our correspondent about the events that lead to this dramatic change in government. And we hear reaction from a journalist who had been jailed 6 years ago for criticizing that government.
title: Protests Force Bangladesh's Longest-Serving Prime Minister to Flee

description: Thomas settled for bronze in the 200m at the Tokyo Olympics. There would be no settling this time as she cruised to victory to claim gold at the Paris Olympics at Stade de France.
title: Gabby Thomas dominates 200 meter Olympic final, capturing her first gold medal

description: An unlikely group of supporters are lining up in support of Vice President Kamala Harris: Wall Street executives.
title: The evolution of Kamala Harris' relationship with Wall Street

description: Kamala Harris has tapped Minnesota governor Tim Walz to be her running mate. Democrats hope he can secure Midwestern swing states.
title: Can Tim Walz secure Midwestern swing states? That's what Democrats are hoping

description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with former U.S. Deputy Secretary of State John J. Sullivan about his new book, "Midnight in Moscow."
title: What Putin is like in person, according to the former Ambassador to Russia

description: At the Paris Olympics, the sport of "breaking" makes its debut later this week. For the U.S. athletes, they're prepping for their moment in the spotlight.
title: U.S. break dancers prepare for their Olympic debut in Paris

description: Tim Walz is a second-term Minnesota gove with a folksy demeanor who helped green light a slate of progressive policy priorities in Minnesota.
title: Democrats hope Walz can win over voters in Midwestern swing states

description: Weighted infant sleepwear companies say their products are safe and help babies sleep, but some medical experts, safe-sleep advocates and government regulators warn the garments could be dangerous.
title: U.S. lawmakers urge banning weighted infant sleepwear over safety concerns

description: Vice President Harris has upended the presidential race and has now built a 51%-48% lead over former President Trump, according to the latest NPR/PBS News/Marist poll.
title: Poll: Harris jumps to a small national lead over Trump

description: American middle-distance runner Cole Hocker smashed his own personal best time and beat the Olympic record to seize a gold medal in Paris, defeating the heavily-favored British and Norwegian athletes.
title: American Cole Hocker scores major upset in 1,500-meter final and sets Olympic record

description: To labor advocates, Minnesota is considered one of the best places in America to be a worker. Last year, the Democratic legislature passed and Gov. Walz signed a sweeping package of pro-labor laws.
title: 4 reasons why labor unions love Tim Walz

description: Jeremy Green Eche of Brooklyn buys websites for hypothetical presidential tickets and saves them for years. He’s owned HarrisWalz.com since 2020, and hopes to sell it to the campaign for $15,000.
title: The self-proclaimed GOAT of cybersquatting owns HarrisWalz.com, at least for now

description: The U.S. women’s national team, one of the world’s most dominant and successful programs, hadn’t made it to the gold medal game at an Olympics since 2012. The U.S. will now play for its fifth gold.
title: U.S. women’s soccer team defeats Germany and will play for Olympic gold in Paris

description: "Bad behavior has significant consequences,” the attorney representing families in a class-action lawsuit says. The remains of nearly 200 people were found at the Return to Nature Funeral Home.
title: The owners of a Colorado funeral home are ordered to pay $950M over mishandled remains

description: Ángel Barajas showed off acrobatic skills as a kid (making the neighbors nervous). This week he became the first Colombian to win an Olympic gymnastics medal for his soaring horizontal bar routine.
title: Colombia goes gaga over gymnast Ángel Barajas: From fence jumper to Olympic medalist

description: In 1997, the minimum age for women gymnasts was raised to 16. Some thought it would usher in a less competitive era. Instead, athletes of incredible skill and longevity emerged.
title: How older athletes powered up and transformed women's gymnastics

description: Refreshing ideas that harness the excitement of going back to school -- like learning new things, packing a school lunch and playing at recess -- updated for the adult version of you.
title: 6 ways grown-ups can recreate that fresh, buzzy feeling of a new school year

description: The Chinese American physicist, who in 1957 became the second-youngest scientist to receive a Nobel Prize, died on Sunday at his home in San Francisco.
title: Nobel Prize-winning physicist Tsung-Dao Lee has died at age 97

description: Each year, nearly half a million migrants cross the perilous stretch of jungle between South and Central America. Pulitzer Prize-winning Atlantic reporter Caitlin Dickerson made the harrowing journey.
title: Heat, flash floods and bandits: Migrants risk it all on the treacherous Darién Gap

description: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Senator Amy Klobuchar (D-Minn.) about Minnesota Governor Tim Walz joining the White House ticket.
title: Senator Amy Klobuchar on Vice President Harris picking Gov. Tim Walz as her running mate

description: A Martinez asks 2012 Obama campaign manager Jim Messina about Vice President Kamala Harris picking Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz as her running mate.
title: How Harris' VP pick, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, will impact her campaign for president

description: Vice President Kamala Harris picked Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz as her running mate. Walz is the chair of the Democratic Governors Association, an ex-Army National Guard leader and a former teacher.
title: Harris picks Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz as her running mate

description: Kauli Vaast of Tahiti and Team USA's Caroline Marks both won gold on Monday, capping off a dramatic few days of competition that even included a brief appearance by a whale.
title: A whale got its turn in the spotlight on the last day of Olympic surfing

description: As the war drags on with Russia, Ukrainians are desperate for symbols of hope and normalcy. At the Paris Olympics, Ukrainian athletes are doing their part: winning gold to help buoy the country.
title: With their nation under siege, Ukrainian athletes shine at Paris Olympics

description: Google says it plans to appeal the ruling in an antitrust lawsuit that calls the company a monopoly. And, Harris to announce her running mate today in Philadelphia.
title: Google loses in antitrust lawsuit. And, Harris to announce VP pick

description: Some economists urged the Fed to slash interest rates — possibly even before its next meeting. NPR's Michel Martin talks to Moody's chief economist Mark Zandi about fears for an economic downturn.
title: A global stock sell-off included the Dow Industrials tumbling 1,000 points

description: A list of reasons why generative AI may be overhyped.
title: 10 reasons why AI may be overrated

description: A memorial in Ferguson, Missouri, where Michael Brown, a Black teen who was killed by a white police officer remains active 10 years later. NPR's Michel Martin talks local journalist Linda Lockhart.
title: Revisiting where Michael Brown, a Black teen, was killed 10 years ago in Ferguson

description: The Brazilian government has proposed a 2% global wealth tax on the uber-rich. It would impact the 3,000 wealthiest people in the world.
title: A proposal to tax the uber-rich is gaining traction. But there are skeptics

description: NPR’s Morning Edition asked America’s Test Kitchen for help in testing chocolate chip cookie recipes generated by ChatGPT and DishGen.
title: Can AI make better chocolate chip cookie recipes than humans? We taste tested 2

description: Acts range from family-friendly slapstick to edgy standup at the four-day comedy event held in Jamestown, N.Y., home of the I Love Lucy star.
title: Lucille Ball’s hometown is a comedy destination. No joke.

description: Democratic Congresswoman Cori Bush faces a tough primary challenge from St. Louis County Prosecutor Wesley Bell in what's shaping up to be one of the most expensive House primary races ever.
title: Missouri Congresswoman Cori Bush faces a primary challenger backed by pro-Israel groups

description: Nancy Pelosi opens up about wielding power — and what she was doing in the days leading up to President Joe Biden announcing he was abandoning his race for a second term
title: Nancy Pelosi talks to NPR about wielding power — and her role as Biden stepped aside

description: Of the top three potential running mates, Mark Kelly has the highest favorability rating overall and is particularly strong with independents. Harris is set to make her announcement Tuesday.
title: Poll: Arizona's Kelly is most liked as Harris' VP pick, but the field isn't well known

description: Expectations are high that a member of the U.S. women’s weightlifting team could win gold at the Olympics. And among the team’s most promising athletes is 21-year-old Olivia Reeves.
title: Weightlifting 101: How Olivia Reeves plans to win an Olympic gold in Paris

description: In South Carolina, people are being urged to stay off the roads as the remnants of Hurricane Debby move across the state. The storm has soaked Florida and Georgia as it creeps along the coast.
title: Debby threatens coastal South Carolina and other regions with historic flooding

description: A federal judge rules that Google illegally abused its monopoly power to maintain its control over the search engine business. Google says it’s appealing.
title: Google has lost a major antitrust lawsuit. What's next for the search giant?

description: Harris was mentioned 19 times on the account, according to the complaint, including several times in the days after announcing she was running for president in place of Biden.
title: A Virginia man has been arrested for allegedly threatening to kill Kamala Harris

description: The secretary-general's office did not elaborate on the UNRWA staffers' likely role in the attack or on the evidence that prompted its decision.
title: U.N. fires 9 more staffers over potential involvement in Oct. 7 attack on Israel

description: Prosecutors concluded that the staff at the Marion County Record committed no crimes before former Marion Police Chief Gideon Cody led a raid on its offices and the home of its publisher.
title: Prosecutors say they plan to charge former police chief over Kansas newspaper raid
